<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 278, 232, 294]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 450, 763, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 466, 809, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 482, 566, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 498, 487, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 528, 870, 558]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 559, 484, 573]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 574, 885, 603]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 603, 860, 633]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 666, 215, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 682, 386, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 697, 732, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 767, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(4^{x - 2} = 4^{x} - 4^{2}\), giving your answer correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 616, 92]]<|/det|>
By first expanding \(\cos (x - 60^{\circ})\), show that the expression

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 100, 586, 119]]<|/det|>
\[2\cos (x - 60^{\circ}) + \cos x\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 125, 920, 160]]<|/det|>
can be written in the form \(R\cos (x - \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^{\circ}< \alpha < 90^{\circ}\). Give the exact value of \(R\) and the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 144, 920, 163]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 714, 186, 732]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 712, 920, 746]]<|/det|>
Hence find the value of \(x\) in the interval \(0^{\circ}< x< 360^{\circ}\) for which \(2\cos (x - 60^{\circ}) + \cos x\) takes its least possible value.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 728, 920, 747]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 475, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(\ln (x + y) = x - 2y.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 109, 146, 128]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 102, 395, 131]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{x + y - 1}{2(x + y) + 1}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the point on the curve where the tangent is parallel to the \(x\)-axis. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[490, 44, 507, 63]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<label>1</label>

<label>0</label>

<label>0</label>

<label>0</label>

<label>0</label>

<label>0</label>

<label>0</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[778, 72, 818, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[322, 82, 714, 288]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 308, 920, 361]]<|/det|>
In the diagram, \(OABCD\) is a pyramid with vertex \(D\). The horizontal base \(OABC\) is a square of side 4 units. The edge \(OD\) is vertical and \(OD = 4\) units. The unit vectors \(\mathbf{i}\), \(\mathbf{j}\) and \(\mathbf{k}\) are parallel to \(OA\), \(OC\) and \(OD\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 370, 707, 390]]<|/det|>
The midpoint of \(AB\) is \(M\) and the point \(N\) on \(CD\) is such that \(DN = 3NC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 402, 146, 420]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 402, 581, 420]]<|/det|>
Find a vector equation for the line through \(M\) and \(N\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 403, 920, 420]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 680, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that the length of the perpendicular from \(O\) to \(MN\) is \(\frac{1}{3}\sqrt{82}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 74, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
A large plantation of area \(20 \mathrm{km}^2\) is becoming infected with a plant disease. At time \(t\) years the area infected is \(x \mathrm{km}^2\) and the rate of increase of \(x\) is proportional to the ratio of the area infected to the area not yet infected.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 138, 364, 165]]<|/det|>
When \(t = 0, x = 1\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 180, 146, 198]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 178, 551, 198]]<|/det|>
Show that \(x\) and \(t\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[443, 203, 554, 235]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = \frac{19x}{20 - x}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 212, 920, 230]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 504, 186, 522]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 504, 920, 537]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation and show that when \(t = 1\) the value of \(x\) satisfies the equation \(x = \mathrm{e}^{0.9 + 0.05x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 523, 920, 541]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 485, 92]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(-\sqrt{3} + \mathrm{i}\) is denoted by \(u\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
Express \(u\) in the form \(r\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta}\), where \(r > 0\) and \(-\pi < \theta \leqslant \pi\), giving the exact values of \(r\) and \(\theta\). [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 475, 185, 494]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 475, 520, 494]]<|/det|>
Hence show that \(u^{6}\) is real and state its value.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 476, 920, 495]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[166, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
(i) On a sketch of an Argand diagram, shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) satisfying the inequalities \(0 \leqslant \arg (z - u) \leqslant \frac{1}{4}\pi\) and \(\operatorname {Re}z \leqslant 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 540, 193, 559]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 540, 920, 577]]<|/det|>
Find the greatest value of \(|z|\) for points in the shaded region. Give your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 555, 920, 574]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 74, 569, 92]]<|/det|>
